results.title: Equal chances: equal opportunities
results.creator_credit: Jean Leduc and Les Films d'Olivier
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “European Community”.
Deals with the notion of equal work for equal pay. Shows examples of women employed in non-traditional jobs. Encourages girls to look at all areas of employment and suggests that equality of job opportunity should begin at school.

results.title: Epileptic seizure patterns
results.brief_description: A brief outline of the historic ideas about epilepsy and a description of modern methods of diagnosis, showing patients undergoing seizures of varying degrees of intensity, during which psychological changes are observed. The convulsions are correlated with an EEG graph.

results.title: Epilepsy: Yes! You can help
results.brief_description: Affecting one or two people in every 100, epilepsy manifests itself through three different kinds of seizures - tonic colonic, absence and complex partial. Using dramatised re-enactments and discussions with sufferers, this short program describes what it’s like to suffer an attack and what you can do if you witness one. Narrated by Nina Landis.

results.title: Epilepsy: a label for life
results.brief_description: Epilepsy arouses feelings of prejudice and fear amongst members of the community, mainly based on ignorance. Discussed are the types of epilepsy, and use of drugs in treatment. The film also deals with the social and employment problems encountered by epileptics.

results.title: Enya: Moonshadows
results.creator_credit: Michael Geoghegan, M-Oceans Pictures and Warner Music UK
results.brief_description: This compilation of film clips is a must-see for Enya fans. The film clips add to the dreamy qualities inherent in Enya’s music style. Featuring some of her soundtracks made for film, the compilation includes: Orinoco Flow, Exile, Storm in Africa, Evening Falls, Caribbean Blue.

results.title: Environment: the British example - a German view = London so long, smog
results.creator_credit: Fritz Gebhardt, Rudolf Rosthof and NDR TV
results.brief_description: In 1952 4,000 people died as a result of “smog”, a mixture of natural fog, soot and smoke, containing poisonous waste gases. The ensuing Clean Air Act designated smokeless zones and all soft coal fires were banned in London. Shows how inspectors keep a close watch on domestic and industrial air pollution, so that smog is a thing of the past.

results.title: England: home and beauty
results.brief_description: Domestic architecture, interior furnishing and the design of household objects were the subject of a protracted debate during the 1930’s. To increase Britain’s export sales, standards of design had to be raised, but there was no consensus for either of the two contenders-Bauhaus and Swedish inspired functionalism on the one hand or the jazzy modernistic Art Deco style on the other

results.title: England vs Australia 1958-59 1st Test
results.brief_description: Highlights of the first test in the 1958-59 series, of England vs Australia, played in Brisbane and featuring captains Brian May and Richie Benaud.

results.title: England to Australia in under nine days
results.brief_description: A Fox-Movietone newsreel (vol. 3, ep. 19) from 1932 documenting the arrival of Charles Scott, the first person to fly from England to Australia in under nine days - as the title suggests. He lands in Sydney and is greeted by Sir Charles Kingsford Smith and welcoming crowd. Similar events in Brisbane are also shown.
